check_ins.content:
Jan 29
Dev Standup
PR reviews w/ Michael NeeleyMichael Darryl YipDarryl Austin WitherowAustin Vitor LelisVitor Marcelo ReynaMarcelo 
CreatePaymentIntent not blocking content paint is live in prod
Web Auth revamp in review
Duplicate graphql calls in web refactor in review

Jan 28
Make sure we use config for Recurring defaulting on in Web Giving
Time to paint from Mobile to Web handoff plan w/ Vincent WilsonVincent 
Dev Standup
Linear clean up with things from Dev Standup
Made CreatePaymentIntent non-blocking on Web
Zoom before.png
Attachment options‚Ä¶ before.png
Zoom after.png
Attachment options‚Ä¶ after.n-action.gif
in-action.gif 386 KB View full-size Download

Jan 27
Vercel cold function fixes merged to prod (checking things out periodically all day)
Dev Standup
Future of Web Embeds huddle
Revamped Auth Flow in Web PR ready for review
PR reviews w/ Marcelo ReynaMarcelo

Jan 26
Dev Standup
Vercel Cold Function improvements
Better setup of Sentry with Vercel
Parallelized queries in Web for better performance
More info re: what we had previously identified as Time to paint issues
Time to paint issues is actually a misidentification. We have seen, and cataloged, very impressive responsiveness in time to paint across Web. The things that are really slowing down Web are Vercel Cold Functions. Vincent WilsonVincent rightly pointed out to me that this problem gbetter with scale (not worse). We've also pushed up some changes to our Vercel instance (Fluid Compute and bundle reduction) to improve performance even more. As we test Web Giving, for the time being I believe that we may see occasional blips of "long load times", but we should see that improve on subsequent requests across the app. These changes will probably go live in full to production tomorrow.

Jan 26  
  Dev Standup  
  Vercel Cold Function improvements  
  Better setup of Sentry with Vercel  
  Parallelized queries in Web for better performance  
  More info re: what we had previously identified as Time to paint issues  
  Time to paint issues is actually a misidentification. We have seen, and cataloged, very impressive responsiveness in time to paint across Web. The things that are really slowing down Web are Vercel Cold Functions. Vincent rightly pointed out to me that this problem gets better with scale (not worse). We've also pushed up some changes to our Vercel instance (Fluid Compute and bundle reduction) to improve performance even more. As we test Web Giving, for the time being I believe that we may see occasional blips of "long load times", but we should see that improve on subsequent requests across the app. These changes will probably go live in full to production tomorrow.
